title: GEB meets DOG
text:
The dog ate my homework…
So close to the end of GEB, as all the strands were really coming together… and I left it out on a table. Unfortunately, my dog’s attempt to ingest the material started from the back of the book.




GEB chewed


I rarely pay for rapid shipping of anything, but there’s now an urgent package on its way to me.

title: Scot J Matkovich
text:
Welcome!
I hold a Ph.D in biochemistry and molecular biology and currently work as a computational biologist in drug discovery for cardiovascular and metabolic diseases. One of my greatest interests outside my scientific career and the improvement of public health is making music on the piano in the Western classical tradition; a gateway to many other musical pursuits.

Professional experience
My LinkedIn page has a comprehensive profile. In summary:

Director (Data Sciences & Computational Biology) | Eli Lilly and Co | 2024 - present
Director (Principal Research Scientist() | Eli Lilly and Co | 2018 - 2024
Assistant Professor, Department of Medicine | Washington University in St Louis
Senior Scientist, Department of Medicine | Washington University in St Louis
Postdoctoral appointments at Columbia University in New York and the University of Cincinnati


Education
Formal degrees

Ph.D (Biochemistry & Molecular Biology), University of Melbourne, Parkville, Australia. Thesis title ‘Inositol phosphate generation in the heart: mechanisms and functional relevance’
BSc (Hons.), Department of Physiology, University of Melbourne, Parkville, Australia
BA / BSc, University of Melbourne, Parkville, Australia. Majors: French, German, music, biochemistry, physiology

Certifications

Multiple edX and Coursera programs in statistics and data science, including most elements of the reputable Johns Hopkins Data Science Specialization series
A.Mus.A (Associate in Music, Australia) in piano performance from the Australian Music Examinations Board
